li.activateDescString: Make someone inject the syringe into their veins.

li.AnomalyDesc:
A medical syringe filled with a viscous black liquid. 

The liquid regenerates after being expelled.

Classified as Class-0 (Safe) anomaly.
li.label: #1/4 Anomalous syringe study report
li.text:
Properties of the Syringe's liquid

Subject: {PAWN_nameDef}

Abstract:
The Anomalous Syringe appears to be capable of producing the viscous black liquid contained within it. After a couple minutes outside the syringe, the liquid appears to vanish. When mixed with human blood, the liquid takes significantly longer to dissipate, perhaps injecting it into a human could lead to fruitful results.

Observations:
Subject was presented with the anomalous syringe. With considerable effort {PAWN_nameDef} was able to eject the liquid from the syringe.
Subject then pulled back on the syringe and liquid reappeared in the syringe.
{PAWN_nameDef} observed that the liquid vanished after 4 minutes outside the syringe, however upon mixing it with fresh blood it stayed for a couple hours.

Discussion:
The Anomalous Syringe has been classified as Class-0 (Safe) anomaly.

Recommendations:
Injection of the syringe into a human is necessary in order to determine how it reacts to the body.

li.AnomalyDesc:

The sample regenerates after being expelled.

Classified as Class-1 (Warning) anomaly.
li.label: #2/4 Anomalous syringe study report
li.text:
Injection of the virus

Subject: {PAWN_nameDef}

Abstract:
Upon injection the subject was rapidly cured of all previous infections. The virus has shown an ability to mutate itself and to cause decay in the body. It is recommended to proceed with caution.

Observations:
Subject was told to inject themselves with the syringe. {PAWN_nameDef}, who had been suffering with a particularly nasty case of the plague, felt better almost within minutes.
Upon testing the subjects blood, no traces of the plague were found at all. It had been entirely eradicated. However, worryingly it was noticed that certain blood cells had also mutated by the virus. The virus also seems to slowly mutate, gaining a new ability every few days.

Discussion:
The Anomalous Syringe has been reclassified as Class-1 (Caution) anomaly.

Recommendations:
Further research into the potential effects of the phthoravirus. It may be possible to harness the phthoravirus but it is suspected that it is not as benign as it appears.

li.label: #3/4 Anomalous syringe study report
li.text:
Phthoravirus Stages

Analysis of the effects of the phthoravirus have discovered the course of action the virus will take.

Stage 1+ (Purging): The virus acts as a secondary, hyperactive immune system. It will purge the host body of all diseases very quickly.
Stage 2+ (Repairing): The virus turbocharges mitosis in the host body leading to quicker injury recovery times.
Stage 3+ (Hardening): The virus forms an shell of bioferrite between the layers of skin in the host's body. The shell appears to have the approximate effectiveness of flak.
Stage 4+ (Nullifying): The virus blocks the host's pain recepters rendering them incapable of feeling pain.
Stage 5+ (Transforming): The virus starts generating its own replacement cells, able to heal any injury or missing parts.
Stage 6 (Transformation): The virus has created enough replacement cells to transform the host into an anomalous creature. The process is irreversible.

li.text: Research into the phthoravirus has revealed that a modified strain of influenza may be able to fight back against the virus, delaying the next mutation.\nThis strain of influenza will have more detrimental effects the further along the phthoravirus is, and it cannot reverse a mutation if has already occured nor can it fully eradicate the phthoravirus.
